name: Search
description: Make a Wisdom check to discern something that isn't obvious, such as hidden objects, creatures, or other information
requirements: Must have at least one applicable skill (Insight, Medicine, Perception, or Survival)

effects.description: When you take the Search action, you make a Wisdom check to discern something that isn't obvious. The GM determines which skill is applicable based on what you're trying to detect.
mechanicalEffects: Make a Wisdom check using an appropriate skill
Insight: Discern a creature's state of mind
Medicine: Determine a creature's ailment or cause of death
Perception: Locate a concealed creature or object
Survival: Follow tracks or find food
The GM sets the DC based on the difficulty of finding what you seek

restrictions: Must describe where and how you are searching
Searching nowhere near a hidden object won't reveal it, regardless of check total
GM determines which skill applies to the search
Some things may be impossible to find without magic or special equipment
examples: A rogue uses Perception to search a room for hidden traps
A ranger uses Survival to track bandits through the forest
A cleric uses Medicine to determine the cause of a mysterious death
A paladin uses Insight to determine if the merchant is lying about the artifact's origin

searchSkills.insight: Use to discern a creature's state of mind, intentions, or truthfulness
searchSkills.medicine: Use to diagnose an illness or determine what killed a recently deceased creature
searchSkills.perception: Use to notice concealed creatures, hidden objects, or other details in your environment
searchSkills.survival: Use to track creatures, forage for food, or identify natural hazards

additionalRules.passivePerception: The GM may use your Passive Perception score (10 + Perception bonus) to determine if you notice things without actively searching
additionalRules.hiddenObjects: If you describe your character searching nowhere near a hidden object, a Wisdom (Perception) check won't reveal the object, no matter the check's total
additionalRules.advantage: The GM might grant Advantage if you describe a particularly clever search method or have appropriate tools
